column23:
I am the lost child. Father Ted’s Mary. I finished December 71 because I couldn’t afford the tuition and my major was completed. I have the documents to prove that I was granted a Notre Dame major. I was overlooked. I reached out to President Beauchamp many years ago. He found my records. He added me to the class roll for 72. Now almost 50 years later::: I reached out and pled my case. Before I die::: please acknowledge me and grant my diploma. They brush me off. Father Beauchamp referred me to the powers that be. Regardless::: they ignore the truth. Now they say they don’t have my records.
Father Ted is gone. He hugged me to his chest the last time I saw him.
My father was a Knute Rockne 29 and 30 monogram. He is buried about 20 feet from Knute. I attended team reunions from a young age. I knew the four horsemen::: Frank Leahy::: Hunk Anderson. And Pat O’Brien. They always said I couldn’t attend ND as a girl. I gave up a scholarship to Wellesley and matriculated through SMC when a merger was anticipated. My advisor Sr Franzita Kane guides me through petitioning the ND major. I had to meet the UND requirements and not those if SMC. I had a meal pass and parked every morning at the stadium. I couldn’t go in the dorms::: so I stayed in the library between classes. Father Ted let me use a carrel on his 13th floor outside his office.
I finished summa cum laude. I went on to honors in medical school. I am an eye surgeon. I also have an MBA in healthcare and a graduate certificate from the university of London.
I have proven myself worthy of their acknowledgement
. I am the lost child.
Mary Davies did what I did and got a sheepskin. Mary Ellen Stolz got a lawyer. I don’t want to do that unless I have to.
I am calling out to the ND community. Take me home::: please.
Mary

column28:
I think the authors miss the starting point relative to what we’re seeing in numbers of asymptomatic cases as well as how close we are to exceeding hospital capacity as a nation. While NYC has been inundated::: other hospitals are seeing furloughs because of low census numbers (including mine). Further::: To that end I think these models need to be applied regionally::: rather than one to fit them all across the US. It changes the parameters significantly::: and the Rate of contact between infected and susceptible is widely variable across the country. I don’t think there will be a scenario in which we exceed Hospital capacity by 20-fold::: and 5% cumulative population mortality would exceed 15 million in the US.

The ideas and calculations here are likely quite right::: but the starting points are off because necessarily we don’t know enough about who is getting infected::: who remains asymptomatic::: and who amongst those can transmit the virus and with what efficiency.
column29: We need to use our heads and use our renewed diligence to health and well being. We need to wash our hands::: not shake hands or hug::: stay home if sick::: cover our coughs::: carry hand sanitizer etc. and LIVE!!!! We can’t hide in our homes and let life pass us by. We just can’t! The at risk or fearful can isolate and stay safe. That’s their option. We can coexist. We must!

column31: We are not locking ourselves at home until we can test every American or until there is a vaccine::: sorry. From the development of the formulae for synthetic rubber::: to the first wireless radio transmission::: to pioneering research into human flight::: Notre Dame has been home to scholars whose accomplishments reverberate throughout history.

Congratulations to Patrick Hidalgo McCabe!

McCabe::: a junior::: has been named a 2020 Truman Scholar::: becoming the ninth Notre Dame student selected for the award since 2010 — a list that includes three eventual Rhodes Scholars.

Notre Dame junior Patrick McCabe named 2020 Truman Scholar

column1:
This afternoon::: Fr. Jenkins announced the online Degree Conferral Ceremony on Sunday::: May 17 will take place at 1:00 p.m. EDT.

The full celebration of the Class of 2020 has been postponed until Memorial Day weekend 2021::: when we will gather to properly honor the graduates with a Commencement ceremony in Notre Dame Stadium::: a Commencement Mass::: and other ceremonies and events to mark this important occasion.

CORONAVIRUS.ND.EDU
Fr. Jenkins: More details on degree conferral ceremony May 17

column10:
Revelation 22 Revised Standard Version Catholic Edition (RSVCE)

The River of Life

22 Then he showed me the river of the water of life::: bright as crystal::: flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb 2 through the middle of the street of the city; also::: on either side of the river::: the tree of life[a] with its twelve kinds of fruit::: yielding its fruit each month; and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations. 3 There shall no more be anything accursed::: but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it::: and his servants shall worship him; 4 they shall see his face::: and his name shall be on their foreheads. 5 And night shall be no more; they need no light of lamp or sun::: for the Lord God will be their light::: and they shall reign for ever and ever.

6 And he said to me::: “These words are trustworthy and true. And the Lord::: the God of the spirits of the prophets::: has sent his angel to show his servants what must soon take place. 7 And behold::: I am coming soon.”

Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.

Epilogue and Benediction

8 I John am he who heard and saw these things. And when I heard and saw them::: I fell down to worship at the feet of the angel who showed them to me; 9 but he said to me::: “You must not do that! I am a fellow servant with you and your brethren the prophets::: and with those who keep the words of this book. Worship God.”

10 And he said to me::: “Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this book::: for the time is near. 11 Let the evildoer still do evil::: and the filthy still be filthy::: and the righteous still do right::: and the holy still be holy.”

12 “Behold::: I am coming soon::: bringing my recompense::: to repay every one for what he has done. 13 I am the Alpha and the Omega::: the first and the last::: the beginning and the end.”

14 Blessed are those who wash their robes:::[b] that they may have the right to the tree of life and that they may enter the city by the gates. 15 Outside are the dogs and sorcerers and fornicators and murderers and idolaters::: and every one who loves and practices falsehood.

16 “I Jesus have sent my angel to you with this testimony for the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David::: the bright morning star.”

17 The Spirit and the Bride say::: “Come.” And let him who hears say::: “Come.” And let him who is thirsty come::: let him who desires take the water of life without price.

18 I warn every one who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: if any one adds to them::: God will add to him the plagues described in this book::: 19 and if any one takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy::: God will take away his share in the tree of life and in the holy city::: which are described in this book.

20 He who testifies to these things says::: “Surely I am coming soon.” Amen. Come::: Lord Jesus!

21 The grace of the Lord Jesus be with all the saints.[c] Amen.
